a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Countries adopting the International Classification of Diseases
The number of countries that have reported to the WHO Mortality Database using a given version of the International
Classification of Diseases (ICD) to classify causes of death.
Note: Countries are only included in the WHO Mortality Database if over 65% of deaths have a registered cause. There is at least an
18-month lag before countries report finalized data; it should not be inferred from this chart that reporting for the most recent years has
